intro: Bunochilus readii, commonly known as the red-flowered oxalis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and vibrant red flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Bunochilus readii thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
